Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nicomicin-1 (natural AMPs; marine polychaetes; annelid, invertebrates, animals; 1s=s; XXU; ucss1A;  more AMPs)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 42.9% similarity toPalustrin-2c.Activity: Active against Gram+ M. luteus (MIC 0.125 uM), B. subtilis (0.062 uM), B. licheniformis (0.125 uM), S. aureus 209P (2 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 (2 uM), Rhodococcus sp. (0.125 uM), Gram- bacteria E. coli BL21 (DE3) (MIC 2 uM), E. coli ML-35p (MIC 16 uM), A. baumannii (MIC 32 uM), P. aeruginosa PAO1 (32 uM). At 16 uM, it didn't inhibit B-megaterium.Antimicrobial robustness: The activity is salt-sensitive.Animal model:mouse:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 3/2020
Literature Information.Author: Panteleev PV, Tsarev AV, Bolosov IA, Paramonov AS, Marggraf MB, Sychev SV, Shenkarev ZO, Ovchinnikova TV.2018
Literature Information.Reference: Mar Drugs. 2018 Oct 23;16(11). pii: E401. doi: 10.3390/md16110401.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Novel Antimicrobial Peptides from the Arctic Polychaeta Nicomache minor Provide New Molecular Insight into Biological Role of the BRICHOS Domain.
